marginalia.anchor_text: " A little month: or e're those shooes were old, | " With which she followed my poor fathers body, | " Like Niobe all tears, why she, | " Heaven? a beast that wants discourse of reason | " Would have mourn'd longer, , ,

substitution.copyText: Possess it meerly: that it should come thus,
substitution.amendedText: Possess it meerly: that it should come to this,

substitution.copyText: She used to hang on him,
substitution.amendedText: Why she would hang on him,

substitution.copyText: " Like Niobe all tears, why she,

" A little month: or e're those shooes were old, | " With which she followed my poor fathers body, | " Like Niobe all tears, why she, | " Heaven? a beast that wants discourse of reason | " Would have mourn'd longer, , ,

Than I to Hercules: within a month | " E're yet the salt of most unrighteous tears | " Had left the flushing in her galled eyes, | " She married? O most wicked speed to post | " With such dexterity to incestuous sheets; | " It is not, nor it cannot come to good. | " But break my heart, for I must hold my tongue.
But what make you from Wittenberg?
substitution.amendedText: But what in faith make you from Wittenberg Horatio?

substitution.copyText: But what in faith make you from Wittenberg Horatio?
substitution.amendedText: But what in faith make you from Wittenberg?

substitution.copyText: A truant disposition, my good Lord.
substitution.amendedText: A truant disposition, good my Lord. --

substitution.copyText: Wee'l teach you here to drink e're you depart.
substitution.amendedText: Wee'l teach you to drink deep e're you depart.

substitution.copyText: Ham. I prethee do not mock me fellow student.
substitution.amendedText: Ham. I prethee, do not mock me, fellow student;
